items.clinical_text: Body image and self-consciousness regarding weight and size in social settings.
hooks: embarrassed by my weight around others
intense shame about how I look
avoiding people because of my weight

scoring.0: I don't feel self-conscious about my weight or body size when I'm with others or I feel concerned but not disappointed with myself.
scoring.1: I do get self-conscious about my appearance and weight which makes me feel disappointed in myself.
scoring.3: I feel very self-conscious about my weight and frequently feel intense shame and disgust for myself; I try to avoid social contacts.

items.clinical_text: Eating speed and resulting physical sensations of fullness.

scoring.0: I don't have any difficulty eating slowly in the proper manner.
scoring.1: I seem to 'gobble down' foods but don't end up feeling stuffed.
scoring.2: I tend to eat quickly and feel uncomfortably full afterwards.
scoring.3: I have the habit of bolting down my food without really chewing it and feel uncomfortably stuffed.

items.clinical_text: Perceived control over eating urges and level of desperation.
hooks: desperate to get in control of my appetite

scoring.0: I feel capable to control my eating urges when I want to.
scoring.1: I feel like I have failed to control my eating more than the average person.
scoring.3: I feel utterly helpless or desperate about trying to get in control of my eating urges.

items.clinical_text: Habitual eating in response to boredom.
hooks: can't stop eating when there's nothing to do
using food to pass the time

scoring.0: I don't have the habit of eating when I'm bored or I can use some other activity to get my mind off it.
scoring.2: I have a strong habit of eating when I'm bored and nothing seems to help me break it.

items.clinical_text: Impulsive eating and 'mouth hunger' independent of physical hunger.
hooks: spitting food out to avoid weight gain

scoring.0: I'm usually physically hungry when I eat something.
scoring.1: Occasionally, I eat something on impulse even though I really am not hungry.
scoring.2: I eat foods I might not enjoy just to satisfy a hungry feeling that isn't physical.
scoring.3: I get a 'mouth hunger' that only sandwiches or filling foods satisfy; I sometimes spit food out.

items.clinical_text: Feelings of guilt or self-hate following episodes of overeating.

scoring.0: I don't feel any guilt or self-hate after I overeat.
scoring.1: After I overeat, occasionally I feel guilt or self-hate.
scoring.3: Almost all the time I experience strong guilt or self-hate after I overeat.

items.clinical_text: Effect of dieting on eating control and 'blown it' mentality.
hooks: breaking my diet with a binge
eating more because I already broke my diet

scoring.0: I don't lose total control of my eating when dieting even after periods when I overeat.
scoring.2: Eating a 'forbidden food' makes me feel like I 'blew it' and I eat even more.
scoring.3: I have a habit of starting strict diets but breaking them with a binge; my life is 'feast or famine'.

items.clinical_text: Frequency and severity of feeling uncomfortably stuffed or nauseous.
hooks: stuffed to the point of discomfort

scoring.0: I rarely eat so much food that I feel uncomfortably stuffed afterwards.
scoring.1: Usually about once a month, I eat such a quantity of food, I end up feeling very stuffed.
scoring.2: I have regular periods during the month when I eat large amounts of food.
scoring.3: I regularly feel quite uncomfortable and sometimes nauseous from overeating.

scoring.0: My calorie intake does not go up very high or go down very low on a regular basis.
scoring.1: Sometimes I try to reduce my caloric intake to almost nothing to compensate for overeating.
scoring.2: I have a regular habit of overeating during the night.
scoring.3: I have week-long periods where I practically starve myself following periods of overeating.

items.clinical_text: Capacity to stop eating voluntarily and fear of loss of control.
hooks: fear of not being able to stop

scoring.0: I usually am able to stop eating when I want to; I know when 'enough is enough'.
scoring.1: Every so often, I experience a compulsion to eat which I can't seem to control.
scoring.2: Frequently I experience strong urges I can't control, but at other times I can.
scoring.3: I feel incapable of controlling urges and fear not being able to stop eating voluntarily.

items.clinical_text: Ability to stop when full and use of induced vomiting.

scoring.0: I don't have any problem stopping eating when I feel full.
scoring.1: I usually can stop when full but occasionally overeat until I'm uncomfortably stuffed.
scoring.2: I have a problem stopping once I start and usually feel uncomfortably stuffed.
scoring.3: I sometimes have to induce vomiting to relieve my stuffed feeling.

hooks: eating less when others are watching

scoring.0: I seem to eat just as much when I'm with others as when I'm by myself.
scoring.1: I don't eat as much with others because I'm self-conscious.
scoring.2: I eat only a small amount when others are present because I'm very embarrassed.
scoring.3: I pick times to overeat when no one will see me because I'm ashamed; I am a 'closet eater'.

items.clinical_text: Daily meal patterns and heavy snacking habits.

scoring.0: I eat three meals a day with only occasional or normal snacks.
scoring.2: When I am snacking heavily, I get in the habit of skipping regular meals.
scoring.3: There are regular periods when I seem to be continually eating, with no planned meals.

items.clinical_text: Mental preoccupation with controlling eating urges.

scoring.0: I don't think much about trying to control unwanted eating urges.
scoring.1: At least some of the time, my thoughts are pre-occupied with trying to control urges.
scoring.2: I frequently spend much time thinking about how much I ate or trying not to eat.
scoring.3: Most of my waking hours are pre-occupied by thoughts about eating or not eating.

items.clinical_text: General preoccupation with food and cravings.
hooks: thinking about food all the time

scoring.0: I don't think about food a great deal.
scoring.1: I have strong cravings for food but they last only for brief periods of time.
scoring.2: I have days when I can't seem to think about anything else but food.
scoring.3: Most of my days seem to be pre-occupied with thoughts about food; I live to eat.

items.clinical_text: Awareness of physical hunger cues and normal portion sizes.
hooks: not knowing what a normal portion is
don't know how much to eat

scoring.0: I usually know whether or not I'm physically hungry and take the right portion.
scoring.1: Occasionally I feel uncertain about knowing whether or not I'm physically hungry.
scoring.2: I don't have any idea what is a 'normal' amount of food for me.
